Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: Department of the Army  US Army South
Additional Scope Comments: Army Corps of Engineers, RG 77, Office of the Surgeon General RG 112, Army Staff RG 319,  Army Secretariat RG 335, Army Special Operations Command  RG 338, Army Space & Missile Defense Command RG 338,  Army Surface Deployment & Distribution Command RG 338, US Army North/5th Army RG 338, US Army Central RG 338,  US Army Africa RG 338, Army Materiel Command RG 544, US Army Europe RG 549, US Army Pacific RG 550, Army Training & Doctrine Command RG 553, Army Forces Command RG 555 Other emails will be managed using standard Records Management practices based on content of the email.  They will be placed into electronic folders in the Army Records Information Management System (ARIMS).  Army is also pursuing other automated records management solutions with DOD and other DOD Components for use in automated processing of all electronic records.
Legacy Email Scope: Agency will be including legacy email dating back to 2013, as the email journaling policy defined in the Army Regulation 25-400-2 Army Records Information Management System was in place prior to Capstone.
Whom should NARA contact if there any qu: Anthony D. Crawley-Gibson,  Chief, Records Management Division,   anthony.d.crawley-gibson.civ@mail.mil,  703-428-6464

Cutoff Instructions: CUTOFF of email will be by employee tenure.
Transfer Instructions: E-mails will be archived by the DEE for 10 years, then returned to DTIC for holding for another 15 years, for a total of 25 years. At 25 years, they will be transferred to the National Archives.
Legacy Email Scope: Legacy emails prior to the July 2014 email transition to the Defense Enterprise Email, are archived and stored on a backup tape pending disposition in accordance with GRS 3.2 Item 41.
